name: Cake Mix Yeast Rolls
author: RUTHEY
summary: These crescent rolls are fashioned after cake mix cookies and make for easy baking. They're light, tender and topped with poppy seeds.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water
Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes
Stir in the flour and cake mix
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil
Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour
Deflate the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface
Divide the dough into two equal pieces and form into rounds
Let rest for 5 minutes and then roll into 12 inch circles
Brush melted margarine onto the circles
Roll up the wedges, beginning at the wide end
Place on prepared baking sheets with the end of the roll on the bottom
Brush the rolls with margarine and beaten egg white
Cover and let rise until doubled, about 25 minutes
Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown
